meanings.definition: A category within a biological order, ranking above a family and below an order.
meanings.sent1: In the animal kingdom, the suborder Carnivora includes animals like bears and weasels.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the suborder of insects to understand their diverse characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper jokingly referred to the penguins as the 'suborder of tuxedo-wearing waddlers'.
meanings.sent4: The suborder of flowering plants bloomed in a riot of colors, painting the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the suborder of primates helped the students appreciate the diversity of our closest relatives.

meanings.definition: To give an order or command to a subordinate.
meanings.sent1: The general will suborder the troops to advance towards the enemy lines.
meanings.sent2: She will suborder the team to start working on the new project immediately.
meanings.sent3: The boss decided to suborder a pizza for the hardworking employees as a surprise treat.
meanings.sent4: The conductor subordered the musicians to play with more passion, creating a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent5: The coach subordered the players to give their all in the final match, motivating them to victory.
